page.title: 09Conservation in Knowle
page.content: The conservation area at Bentley Heath School was the idea of the then Deputy Head, Richard Edwards. Staff, parents and children helped to develope a haven for plants and wildlife that is being affected by new housing on adjacent green field sites (The countryside around Bently Heath is mentioned is the famous book:"A Country Diary Of An Edwardian Lady" by Edith Holden). The area covers 0.4 acres and was opened by the Mayor of Solihull, Mrs Miriam Harris on July 18th, 1983. The area has been a stimulus for work in Art, Science, Mathematics and English and adjacent classrooms huts form good vantage points. In July 1985, 10 new bungalows are being built right next to the area which 2 Mallards have just started to visit.
